intro: Didiscus glaucifolius, commonly known as the silverleaf didiscus, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, broad, silver-green leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Didiscus glaucifolius is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and drought tolerance.
